entry.title: Longtime Southern Oregon Philanthropist Wanda Olsrud Dies at 100
entry.summary: Wanda Olsrud, longtime Southern Oregon philanthropist and co-founder of the Sherm’s Thunderbird and Food 4 Less brands, has died at age 100. Her decades of quiet generosity helped shape local communities, youth programs, and healthcare across the region.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 12.31.25
entry.summary: An encore program: Kyle Bailey and Rachelle Carter talk about the Fly Away Travel trip to Italy last fall.

entry.title: Police Log - December 30, 2025
entry.summary: Roseburg police handled multiple calls over Dec. 30, ranging from traffic crashes and warrant arrests to disorderly conduct and a reported domestic incident, according to the department’s daily activity log.

entry.title: Ring in the New Year: Douglas County’s New Year’s Eve Parties
entry.summary: Ring in 2026 across Douglas County with live music, themed parties, comedy, and celebrations at local favorites like The Rosebud, Melrose Vineyards, Seven Feathers, and more. Here’s your guide to New Year’s Eve events happening around the county.

entry.title: Former Sutherlin middle school instructor pleads not guilty to sex abuse charges
entry.summary: A former Sutherlin Middle School instructor who is accused of sexually abusing two students appeared in court Tuesday, where she pleaded not guilty to all charges against her.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested on Multiple Theft and Forgery Charges
entry.summary: A 38-year-old Roseburg man was arrested after police say he admitted to theft and forgery-related crimes. Investigators say he stole solar lights, cashed a stolen check for $200, and attempted to cash another for $400.

entry.title: ODF plans virtual informational session on Forest Management Plan proposed rule changes
entry.summary: The Oregon Department of Forestry will host a virtual informational session on a proposed rule change to adopt a new Forest Management Plan for state forest lands managed by the department in western Oregon.

entry.title: City of Roseburg Issues Nuisance Notice to 79-Year-Old Homeowner Over Alleged Camping She Did Not Create
entry.summary: A 79-year-old Roseburg homeowner faces possible prosecution after the city issued a nuisance notice for camping and debris she says she did not create. The notice gives her 10 days to comply or pay a $306 appeal fee.

entry.title: New Year, New Laws: What’s Changing in Oregon on Jan. 1
entry.summary: Oregon rings in the new year with major law changes, including new rules on civil commitment, unemployment for striking workers, ticket sales, telemarketing, and marriage age. Several new consumer and public safety protections also take effect Jan. 1.

entry.title: Arrest Made in Connection With Fatal Shooting in Coos Bay
entry.summary: One person is dead following a shooting in Coos Bay Sunday afternoon. Police say a suspect is in custody, and the Coos County Major Crime Team is leading the investigation. The victim has been identified as 39-year-old David Orr.

entry.title: NMFS denies Oregon, California coastal Chinook salmon status under Endangered Species Act
entry.summary: The National Marine Fisheries Service and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration has determined that two coastal Chinook salmon groups, the Oregon Coast and the Southern Oregon and Northern California Coastal populations, do not warrant protection under the Endangered Species Act.
